newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EU 14 refinery output up in July - Euroilstock.
newsitem.headline: EU 14 refinery output up in July - Euroilstock.

text.p: Net refinery output in the 14 states of the European Union, excluding Sweden, rose in July as production of all oil products increased sharply in Italy, Stichting Euroilstock said in its monthly report.

Refinery output in July rose by 201,000 barrels per day (bpd) (1.7 percent) from June to 11.866 million bpd, while refinery crude intake was up 1.1 percent to 11.234 million bpd. This represented a utilisation rate of 89.16 percent, against 88.16 percent in June.
Throughput was also 2.7 percent higher than in July 1995. The utilisation rate was up 4.54 percent year-on-year.
Total net output was greatest in Italy which alone recorded a rise of 209,000 bpd in July to 1.754 million bpd.
Of oil products, middle distillate output rose sharpest in July, by 86,000 bpd (1.7 percent) to 5.196 million bpd, a 5.2 percent increase on July 1995
Motor gasoline production was up 32,000 bpd (1.0 percent) in July to 3.292 million bpd, 2.4 percent higher than last year.
Fuel oil output rose 47,000 bpd (2.8 percent) in July to 1.739 million bpd, 2.8 percent higher year on year.
Naphtha production slipped by 15,000 bpd (1.7 percent) to 880,000 bpd, but this was 5.5 percent higher than in July 1995.
They are based on a nameplate capacity of 12.6 million barrels per day. Refinery intake represents crude only and excludes natural gas liquids, feedstocks and other inputs.
